properties.name: 3D First Person
properties.description: A 3D first person movement example featuring 3D first person movement on the X and Y planes, the pointer lock extension, and mobile controls

events.comment: Camera object rotates along with the player's cursor, and the in game camera rotates based on the position of the Camera object
To allow player to walk under an object, it needs to be neglected from picking when separating from obstacles
Moving the Camera object along the X/Y plane with forces

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SpriteMultitouchJoystick
description: Multitouch joysticks can be used the same way as physical gamepads:
- Controls mapping for top-down movement and platformer characters
There are ready-to-use joysticks in the asset-store [multitouch joysticks pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=multitouch-joysticks-multitouch-joysticks).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: PANDAKO-GitHub
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: MousePointerLock
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This behavior removes the limit on the distance the mouse can move and hides the cursor.
description: This behavior removes the limit on the distance the mouse can move and hides the cursor.
For example, a user can rotate or continue to manipulate an object by moving the mouse endlessly ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://mouse-pointer-lock)).
Without the pointer lock, the rotation or operation will stop the moment the pointer reaches the edge of the browser or screen.
Game players don't have to worry about leaving the gameplay area or accidentally clicking on another application that moves the mouse focus away from the game.
Locking the pointer locks `MouseX()` and `MouseY()` expressions.

eventsFunctions.description: Get the movement of the pointer on the X-axis.
eventsFunctions.name: MovementX

eventsFunctions.description: Get the movement of the pointer on the Y-axis.
eventsFunctions.name: MovementY

eventsFunctions.description: Lock the mouse pointer to hide it.
eventsFunctions.name: RequestPointerLock

eventsFunctions.description: Unlocks the mouse pointer and show it.
eventsFunctions.name: ExitPointerLock

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the mouse pointer is locked.
eventsFunctions.name: isPointerLocked
